channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C) Tue, 17 Sep 2024 20:36:30 IST Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd, http://in.indiatimes.com/policyterms/1554651.cms

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'Wearing undergarments must but...': Delta's 'specific' memo for flight attendants
item.description: Delta Airlines has issued a memo detailing the appearance of the candidates applying for the post of flight attendants. Wearing an underwear is a must but it should not be visible. Too long eyelashes are a strict no-no for the appearance of the flight attendants. Visible tattoos must be covered and a maximum of two earrings per ear is allowed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Laura Loomer is called a 'piece of s**t' as she defames Kamala Harris again
item.description: Right-wing activist Laura Loomer said she is being defamed by media that are suggesting that she has an affair with Donald Trump. Laura said the indication is insulting to Donald Trump, Melania Trump and her. She said many working women have no desire to have a sexual relationship with men in politics to climb the ladder and she knows that Kamala Harris can't say the same thing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: North Korea sends top envoy to Russia as it girds for friction with Seoul
item.description: North Korea's foreign minister Choe Son Hui visited Russia for the second time in less than a year, as Pyongyang prepares for a parliamentary meeting likely to escalate tensions with South Korea. The visit follows recent high-level exchanges between the two nations, indicating deepening cooperation amid increasing isolation from leading democracies.

item.title: Australia looks beyond Gaganyaan and Moon for space collaboration with India
item.description: Australia and India are expanding their space collaboration, focusing on supporting India's Gaganyaan mission and launching joint satellites. Australian Space Agency Head Enrico Palermo outlines future cooperation in areas like deep space exploration and climate monitoring. He emphasizes the mutual benefits and challenges of this strategic alliance, aiming to enhance regional cooperation and technological advancement.
item.dc:creator: Chethan Kumar

item.title: Barron Trump was set to give his first public speech. Then this happened
item.description: Barron Trump was expected to deliver his first public speech at a virtual event for the launch of World Liberty Financial, a new crypto exchange. But when it was his turn to speak, as he among the Trumps understands crypto the best, he was nowhere to be found. "Damn teenagers," Donald Trump Jr said in a mild rebuke to his brother. When Donald Trump spoke, he revealed that Barron has got four wallets.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: EU salvage mission successful after securing burning Houthi-hit oil tanker
item.description: The Greek-owned MV Sounion oil tanker, damaged by Yemen's Houthi fighters, has been safely relocated in the Red Sea with no reported oil spillage. Abandoned after a missile attack on August 21, the tanker carried nearly one million barrels of crude oil. An EU-coordinated salvage operation involving three vessels and a warship prevented an environmental disaster.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When Melania, Jill, Michelle, Hillary met last year: 'First Ladies are not mean girls'
item.description: ​Melania was very smiley but uncertain and was expecting people to be nice to her. "We were. We all went up to her...Jill air-kissed her cheek, and Michelle Obama gave one her of her signature big hugs," Hillary wrote. "Bill tried to make conversation, asking her how she was, but he was met with a smile and few words. I reached out, shook her hand, ” Hillary wrote.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Is Sri Lanka next? How presidential polls could impact Delhi-Colombo ties
item.description: Sri Lanka's presidential election on September 21 holds significant implications for its foreign relations with India. Key candidates who'll be fighting the upcoming elections include Ranil Wickremesinghe, Sajith Premadasa, and Anura Kumara Dissanayake. Amid a severe economic crisis, the election's outcome is crucial for regional stability and India's strategic interests in South Asia.
item.dc:creator: Aarushi Batra

item.title: Chinese warplanes tail US military aircraft in Taiwan strait
item.description: Chinese warplanes tailed a US P-8A Poseidon aircraft through the Taiwan Strait, according to the PLA's Eastern Theater Command. This incident comes amid heightened regional tensions and follows Germany's recent naval transit through the strait. The US Navy has not yet commented on this event.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Japan suspends trial removal of Fukushima nuclear debris
item.description: TEPCO has suspended efforts to extract highly radioactive material from Japan's Fukushima nuclear plant due to a technical problem with remote cameras. This extraction is essential for decommissioning the facility, which was severely damaged by a tsunami in 2011. Engineers must resolve this issue before continuing the operation.

item.title: Terrorists target military school in Mali capital: Army
item.description: Mali's army stated that Bamako is under control after an early morning terrorist attack on a gendarmerie training school. Gunfire was reported across the city, prompting residents to stay indoors. This incident highlights the persistent security issues in Mali, which has been fighting an Islamist insurgency since 2012.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Georgia woman dies after abortion ban causes delay in medical care
item.description: Amber Nicole Thurman, a 28-year-old single mother from Georgia, died after complications arose during an abortion procedure delayed by Georgia’s six-week abortion ban. This incident is the first verified death linked to such bans post-Roe v Wade. A state committee deemed her death preventable if timely medical intervention had been provided.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hoiho wins New Zealand's Bird of the Year award
item.description: The yellow-eyed penguin, known as hoiho, secured New Zealand’s Bird of the Year award, drawing attention to its endangered status. With a population drop of 78% in 15 years, this recognition is timely. Endorsements from notable figures and various groups contributed to the successful campaign aimed at boosting conservation efforts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Whether we like it or not ... ': Donald Trump introduces World Liberty Financial, his new cryptocurrency venture
item.description: After an assassination attempt, Donald Trump introduced his new cryptocurrency venture, World Liberty Financial, with his sons and two crypto entrepreneurs. The initiative has raised concerns about conflicts of interest if Trump wins the election. The project's specifics are unclear but involve a new cryptocurrency called $WLFI.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Birthday wishes or just formality? The truth behind William's message to Harry
item.description: Prince William shows no interest in reconciling with Prince Harry despite wishing him a happy 40th birthday. The gesture was mainly to align with King Charles, who publicly expressed his love for Harry. Both brothers attended their uncle's funeral but did not interact.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Chinese woman goes into coma after assault by husband, wakes up to permanent blindness
item.description: Lao Chunxue from Inner Mongolia was violently attacked by her husband Xie over money to support his gaming addiction. The assault left her blind and severely injured. Xie was sentenced to 11 years in prison, but Lao's family is appealing for a life sentence. The incident has sparked widespread outrage online.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Meet Jonathan, world's oldest living land animal, who is 191 years old
item.description: Jonathan the Tortoise, born in 1832, is recognized as the oldest known living land animal. Currently residing on Saint Helena, his life exemplifies longevity and resilience. Jonathan's story emphasizes the importance of wildlife conservation and biodiversity preservation, serving as an inspiration for global efforts to protect tortoises and other endangered species.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Women seen without hijabs on Mahsa Amini's death anniversary in Iran
item.description: Women in Iran were observed without hijabs, and prisoners began a hunger strike to commemorate the second anniversary of Mahsa Amini's death. Amini died in custody for allegedly violating dress codes, leading to widespread protests against Iran’s government and its strict hijab laws.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Japan’s elderly population hits record high
item.description: Japan's elderly population has surged to a record high of 36.25 million, representing 29.3 percent of the total populace. This demographic trend is escalating medical and welfare expenses amid a declining labour force. In response, a record number of elderly individuals—9.14 million—were employed in 2023, constituting 13.5 per cent of the workforce.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump assassination bid: Secret Service defends 'textbook' response
item.description: The Secret Service successfully prevented an assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump, with an agent quickly responding to a suspect brandishing a weapon near Mar-a-Lago. Acting Director Ronald Rowe Jr praised the agency’s protective measures but acknowledged the strain on agents after an earlier attempt on Trump in July, which led to public criticism and the resignation of former Director Kimberly Cheatle.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
